libfairness.indices package¶

Submodules¶

libfairness.indices.cvm module¶

libfairness.indices.cvm.compute_cvm(fairness_problem: libfairness.fairness_problem.FairnessProblem, cols=None)¶

Compute the CVM indices of a fairness problem. Set FairnessProblem.result as a Dataframe containing the indices.

Parameters

  • fairness_problem (FairnessProblem) – The fairness problem to study.

  • cols ([type], optional) – [description]. Defaults to None.

libfairness.indices.sobol module¶

libfairness.indices.sobol.apply_marginals(z_cond, F_inv)¶

Apply the computed marginal in order to get back to the original distribution.

Parameters

  • z_cond – the conditionally distributed gaussian vector.

  • F_inv – the inverse cumulative function of each marginal

Returns: the transformed marginals.

libfairness.indices.sobol.compute_marginal_inv_cumul_dist(data_x: type, N=None)¶

Compute the inverse cumulative distribution of each marginal based on empirical data.

Parameters

  • data_x – empirical data as numpy array. rows are observations.

  • N – number of sample used to compute the marginals

Returns: an array of function to compute each marginal. (index indicate which marginal)

libfairness.indices.sobol.compute_sobol(fairness_problem: libfairness.fairness_problem.FairnessProblem, n=1000, N=None, bs=150)¶

Take a function and a dataset and compute the sobol indices. Set a dataframe with the sobol indice (columns) for each variable (rows) in FairnessProblem.result.

Parameters

  • fairness_problem (FairnessProblem) – The fairness problem to study.

  • n (int, optional) – [description]. Defaults to 1000.

  • N ([type], optional) – [description]. Defaults to None.

  • bs (int, optional) – [description]. Defaults to 150.

libfairness.indices.sobol.compute_sobol_table(f, x, y=None, n=1000, N=None)¶

Compute all sobol indices for all variables :param y: :param f: the function to analyze :param x: numpy array containing the data :param n: number of sample used to compute the sobol indices :param N: number of sample used to compute marginals

Returns: a numpy array containing sobol indices (columns) for each variable (row)

libfairness.indices.sobol.empirical_cov(data)¶

compute empirical covariance. :param data: numpy array with the data.

Returns: the covariance matrix of the data

libfairness.indices.sobol.generator(cov, n=100)¶

Generate normally distributed batches :param cov: covariance matrix of the distribution :param n: number of samples

Returns: numpy array containing the samples

libfairness.indices.sobol.reorder_cols(data, col_index, mode, inverse=False)¶

Shift the columns in order put the ith first. :param data: the array we want to swap columns :param col_index: the index of the column to put at the first place :param inverse: if true execute the inverse operation ie. shift the first columns at index i

Returns: the array with shifted columns

Examples

` _reorder_cols([1,2,3], 1, False) = [2,3,1] _reorder_cols([2,3,1], 1, True) = [1,2,3] `

libfairness.indices.sobol.sobol_ind_unnormalized(zc, zcbis, zcquad, f, mode)¶
libfairness.indices.sobol.sobol_indices_at_i(f, variable_index, mode, n, cov, f_inv)¶

Compute the sobol indices for a specific variable. Attention for independent indices, the output is shifted: calling this function on variable i will yield sobol indices for i and sobol_indep indicies for i-1.

Parameters

  • f – the function to analyze

  • variable_index – the column number of the variable we want to analyze.

  • n – number of sample to compute sobol indices.

  • cov – covariance matrix of the data distribution.

  • f_inv – the inverse cumulative distribution functions of the marginals of the data. It is an array of functions

  • variable. (where the index indicate the) –

Returns: The computed sobol indices in the following order: “sobol”, “sobol_total”, “sobol_ind”, “sobol_total_ind”

libfairness.indices.sobol.sobol_table_to_dataframe(sobol_table, variable_names=None)¶

Turn the numpy array into a printable dataframe. Displays confidence intervals when bootstrapping.

Parameters

  • sobol_table – numpy array containing the indices. Can be either 3D (bs, variable, index) when bootstrapping or 2D

  • (variable –

  • not. (index) when) –

  • variable_names – a list with the names of each variable. if None, the variables will be named X1, X2…

Returns: a dataframe with the sobol indices inside.

libfairness.indices.sobol.sobol_total_ind_unnormalized(zcbis, zcquad, f, mode)¶
libfairness.indices.sobol.sobol_total_unnormalized(zcbis, zcter, f, mode)¶
libfairness.indices.sobol.sobol_unnormalized(zc, zcbis, zcter, f, mode)¶

libfairness.indices.standard_metrics module¶

libfairness.indices.standard_metrics.compute_disparate_impact(fairness_problem: libfairness.fairness_problem.FairnessProblem)¶

Compute the disparate impact for all sensitive variables S in FairnessProblem.groups_studied. Set FairnessProblem.result as a dict inwhich keys are the sensitive variables and the values are the disparate inpact values. Disparate impact is defined as P(f(X)=1|S=0) / P(f(X)=1|S=1). When P(f(X)=1|S=1)=0 for a sensitive variable, the associate result will be None.

Parameters

fairness_problem (FairnessProblem) – Data of the fairness problem.
